items.name: Apple
items.fun_fact: That's enough water to fill 5 bathtubs! An apple a day keeps the doctor away, but uses more water than you might think.

items.name: Banana
items.fun_fact: Equivalent to 131 bottles of water! Bananas are mostly grown in tropical regions where water is precious.

items.name: Orange
items.fun_fact: Like running your shower for 28 minutes straight! Citrus fruits need lots of water to stay juicy.

items.name: Tomato
items.fun_fact: That's about 35 bottles of drinking water! Despite being 95% water themselves, tomatoes need lots more to grow.

items.name: Potato
items.fun_fact: Enough to wash 14 loads of laundry! Potatoes are surprisingly thirsty crops.

items.name: Carrot
items.fun_fact: Like flushing a toilet 16 times! Carrots are among the more water-efficient vegetables.

items.name: Bread
items.fun_fact: That's more water than most people drink in 2 years! Wheat production is very water-intensive.

items.name: Rice
items.fun_fact: Equivalent to 416 bottles of water! Rice paddies need to be flooded, making rice one of the thirstiest crops.

items.name: Beef
items.fun_fact: That's enough water to fill a small swimming pool! Livestock requires water for drinking, feed production, and processing.

items.name: Chicken
items.fun_fact: Like taking 288 showers! Much more water-efficient than beef, but still significant.

items.name: Egg
items.fun_fact: About 196 liters per single egg! That's like running your dishwasher 13 times.

items.name: Milk
items.fun_fact: 1000 times its own volume in water! Dairy cows need lots of water to drink and for their feed.

items.name: Coffee
items.fun_fact: Your morning cup uses 140 liters of water! That's like a 7-minute shower for one cup of coffee.

items.name: Tea
items.fun_fact: About 27 liters per cup! Much more water-efficient than coffee but still significant.

items.name: Cotton T-shirt
items.fun_fact: That's 18 full bathtubs of water! Cotton is one of the most water-intensive crops on Earth.
